#12346 contains the following definition

/-- The function which maps the natural number `∑ i in s, 2^i` to the Finset `s`. -/
def Nat.bitSet (n : ℕ) : Finset ℕ := by
  induction' n using binaryRec with b _ s
  · exact ∅
  cases b
  · exact Finset.image (· + 1) s
  · exact insert 0 (Finset.image (· + 1) s)
Could people give their opinion on the name?
I find it jarring that it contains Set but actually returns a Finset

My rationale is that the distinction between Set and Finset is technical rather than mathematical, and when there is no danger of ambiguity the shorter and more familiar name in natural mathematical language should win out.
A bitset in computer science is an array of bits. Is bitset a common term for this set in combinatorics? bitIndices seems like a more instructional name.
That sounds good to me. I'll give this a bit of time for any more suggestions before updating.
(For prior art, it's called a BitSet in Java and BitArray in golang, .NET, Python's bitarray package, and Rust's bitvec crate. This may or may not be relevant to a library for mathematicians.)
Bringing this back - I've done a refactor that redefines BitIndices as a List, and then provides the finset bijection at the end as an easy consequence.
The PR is on my radar but I don't have time before another week
I think comments like this might be counterproductive, as they effectively discourage other reviewers to look in the meantime. Better to just leave the request for review unanswered.
Are they? I think this effectively gives Peter an idea of how long to wait for his PR to get reviewed
People looking for things to review are always welcome to disregard this kind of message

It might be more likely that it is the PR that gets disregarded.

For me it’s more useful if activity in a review thread indicates that something is currently happening.
Another issue is that it's very easy to say "I will look at this in a week" (meaning "I'm busy now but am free in a week") and then completely forget to look at it a week later.
That's actually not the case here since I maintain a list of PRs to go through before I start writing more of my stuff, but I get the concern
